content: The adoration comments must be for President Bush since Ali al-Marri has been confined since the beginning of the war and his latest appeals presented in 2007. This particular hearing was schedule well before Obama was President. Allowing prisoners off without trial was basically reference to those in Gitmo when the President gave orders of shutting the facility down in one year. So much hot air!

content: quote: Originally posted by rayevinsonsr: The adoration comments must be for President Bush since Ali al-Marri has been confined since the beginning of the war and his latest appeals presented in 2007. This particular hearing was schedule well before Obama was President. Allowing prisoners off without trial was basically reference to those in Gitmo when the President gave orders of shutting the facility down in one year. So much hot air! As I'm sure you're aware Ray, most of those who are in Guantanamo are going to be charged with crimes, and tried in either a Civil Court, or a normal Courts Martial - In either of these eventualities - a fair trial. So this business about him "releasing" them is a red herring. As for Ali al-Marri, he was a legal resident of the USA, and was never charged with a crime - Now he HAS been charged with a crime. The idea of holding either a citizen or a legal resident for years without charges is anathma to American tradition. Only with the approval of Congress does the executive have the right to suspend Habeaus. Dave
